content: “This Jesus is the stone that was rejected by you, the builders, which has become the cornerstone. And there is salvation in no one else, for there is no other name under heaven given among men by which we must be saved.” (Acts 4:11-12)

Think about this, evangelicals...think about all those kids separated at the border and then remember what Jesus said: "whatever you do to the least of these, you do it to me." Think long and hard on that one, and then try and tell me that Trump is the "anointed one".

Maria, was that policy already in place before Trump came into office? Did Trump reverse it? Also, are American children separated from their parents daily because their parents either did, or even just 
*MAY HAVE* done, something illegal?
Trump made the zero tolerance policy to separate the children in April.  He then reversed it after over 2000 children were separated.  I hope they can all be found and reunited.  Jesus would cry.
Remember Jesus healed and touched many people who were illegal for him to touch.  He loved and welcomed all....against the rulers.

This is what Jesus said to those he healed, "But afterward Jesus found him in the Temple and told him, “Now you are well; so stop sinning, or something even worse may happen to you.” John 5:14. Isn't going into a country illegal breaking the law? Isn't breaking the law sinning?
